layers

Class PlayerLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • layers.LogicBase
      • layers.PlayerLogic

  • public class PlayerLogic
extends LogicBase

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerLogic(Game layM, GridElement[][] geGrid)
      initializes a PlayerLogic class with methods that help control the player object.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerLogic

        public PlayerLogic(Game layM,
                   GridElement[][] geGrid)
        initializes a PlayerLogic class with methods that help control the player object.
        Parameters:
        layM - Game for communication with other layers
        geGrid - 2D grid containing player space

    • Method Detail

      • setPlayerHeight

        public void setPlayerHeight(int pos)
        sets the player's height position to pos. If pos is greater or equal to the game's set height, it is set to height-1. if pos is less than 0, it is set to 0.
        Parameters:
        pos - height position to set the player

      • movePlayerDown

        public void movePlayerDown()
        moves the player down one

      • movePlayerUp

        public void movePlayerUp()
        moves the player up one

      • generatePlayerTile

        public Tile generatePlayerTile()
        shootTile uses the player to generate a tile to give to the Game to pass to the TileLayer. The player will then have a random color assigned as its next tile to shoot
        Returns:
        the tile generated by the player

      • setPlayerColorEnum

        public void setPlayerColorEnum(GridElement.ColorEnum col)
        Force to change the color of player.
        Parameters:
        col - color to change the player

      • getPlayerPosition

        public IntVector getPlayerPosition()
        Gets the player's position as an IntVector.
        Returns:
        The player's position. Null if no player exists (we should never allow this).

      • getPlayerColor

        public GridElement.ColorEnum getPlayerColor()
        gets the current color of the player
        Returns:
        the color of the player

      • setPlayerInfiniteLaserDrawing

        public void setPlayerInfiniteLaserDrawing(boolean mode)
        Sets the targeting laser mode (this affects drawing only). InfiniteLaserMode true: laser will draw to the end of the screen if there is a clear path. InfiniteLaserMode false: laser will stop on the last column that has tiles on it
        Parameters:
        mode - if true, InfiniteLasermode will be on.

      • setPlayerVisibility

        public void setPlayerVisibility(boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility of the player cannon. Some games may not want to use the cannon functionality.
        Parameters:
        visible - if true, the player will be drawn. If false, the player will be invisible
